message_2:
To solve the inequality 3x + 5 > 7x - 8, we'll first move all the terms with x to one side of the inequality and the constants to the other side.

Step 1: Subtract 3x from both sides of the inequality:
3x + 5 - 3x > 7x - 8 - 3x
5 > 4x - 8

Step 2: Add 8 to both sides of the inequality:
5 + 8 > 4x - 8 + 8
13 > 4x

Step 3: Divide both sides of the inequality by 4:
13/4 > x

So the solution to the inequality is x < 13/4.
